model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Computer

    public class Player
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class representing a player in the Battleship game. It holds its default name, a matrix for each Ship the Player sets and a matrix for each hit the Player receives. For every incoming hit, the Player changes its state according to the result of the hit. When a Player has no Ships on his ships grid, it is considered defeated.
    Author:
    20027017 & 20031485
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isHit

        public void isHit(int row,
                  int col)
        Method mimicking an incoming hit to the Player. It sets a cell of the hits grid to false at the coordinates passed as parameters. It also checks if the coordinates match with the piece of a Ship on the ships grid and decides if a Ship has been hit. It sets the Player's state accordingly.
        Parameters:
        row - The row coordinate being hit
        col - The column coordinate being hit

      • hits

        public int[] hits(int row,
                  int col)
        Returns the coordinates the Player wants to hit.
        Parameters:
        row - The row coordinate.
        col - the column coordinate.
        Returns:
        An integer bidimensional array containing the two coordinates.

      • setShip

        public void setShip(int shipIndex,
                    int row,
                    int col,
                    ShipDirection direction)
        Sets a single Player's Ship onto the Player's game grid.
        Parameters:
        shipIndex - The index of the Ship.
        row - The row coordinate the Ship is going to be set.
        col - The column coordinate the Ship is going to be set.
        direction - The vertical/horizontal direction of the Ship.

      • isDefeated

        public boolean isDefeated()
        Check if the Player is defeated, i.e. if all of its Ships have been sunk.
        Returns:
        True if Player is defeated, false otherwise.
